start.text: Your ship's sensors detect an incoming small meteorite

choices.text: “Probably a false positive again... Maybe one day I'll fix that damn sensor...” [ignore it]
“Alright, I will look at it, but only this one last time!!”

meteorite_not_dangerous_spotted.text: The meteorite is little and composed of rock and ice, it will disintegrate in the atmosphere, nothing to worry about. - You're not sure if the planetary collision-detection system should filter out these harmless objets. You don't remember how you configured it back in the time, and of course this is not documented.

toxic_meteorite_spotted.text: The meteorite is in reality a chemicals container ! - Some company probably rocketed it to the sky instead of paying to destroy it safely

choices.text: Try to guide the population to a safe area

toxic_meteorite.text: The meteorite seems to be a toxic container, we have an issue!

no_meteorite.text: “No meteorite in sight eh? I'm losing my time with these sensors...“

meteorite_not_dangerous.text: The meteorite disintegrates while entering the atmosphere.

toxic_rain.text: When reaching the atmosphere, the container disintegrates, causing a toxic rain.

population_saved.text: Your population followed your path and dodged the toxic rain

population_saved_failed.text: Unfortunately, your population did not follow your path to dodge the toxic rain

toxic_rain_hits_vegetation.description: The toxic rain affects local vegetation

toxic_rain_kills_specimens.description: Some of your specimens don't survive the rain
